trans-unit.source: Represents the element used in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate"></xref> to specify where a decorated control is placed relative to other elements in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate"></xref>.

Use this class only if you are creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> that serves as a custom validation <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Validation.ErrorTemplate%2A> to provide visual feedback when the user input is not valid.
For example, you might want a red exclamation point to appear next to a text box when the input is not valid, as in the following illustration.
![Data binding validation error](~/add/media/databindingdemo-validation.PNG "Data binding validation error") ## XAML Object Element Usage ``` ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object is reserving space for.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> that this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object is reserving space for.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Positions the first visual child object and returns the size in layout required by this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
The size that this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object should use to arrange its child element.
The actual size needed by the element.
Gets or sets the single child object of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
The single child object of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child object at the specified index.
The index that specifies the child object to retrieve.
The visual child object at the specified index.
Gets an enumerator for the logical child elements of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
An enumerator for the logical child elements of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Determines the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
This method measures only the first visual child object.
The returned value is also based on the size of the element for which this <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder> is a placeholder for.
An upper limit value that the return value should not exceed.
The desired size of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object is not part of a template.

Raises the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.IsInitialized*> event. This method is called when <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.IsInitialized*> is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> internally.
Arguments of the event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.AdornedElementPlaceholder"></xref> object is not part of a template.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
Gets the number of visual child objects.
Either 0 or 1.
The default is 0.
